description.S1: You've been asked to recover research data from the safe in Anton Crane's office.

blurb.B1: Head out of Roseway to the southeastern part of the map and enter the Covert Lab.
blurb.B3: who is in charge of security and gives you a summary of the situation.
blurb.B4: You can persuade (45) Porter to give you access to his office,
blurb.B7: you'll come to Anton's Office and his safe,
blurb.B8: only to found that the research has been taken by the Outlaws.

description.S1: Anton's research data was taken from his safe,
description.S3: Search the lab and get it back for them.
description.S4: There's a terminal in Chief Porter's office that can print a security keycard to unlock the doors trapping some of the outlaws.

blurb.B1: If you go toward the middle of the map you'll meet outlaw leader,
blurb.B2: Cassandra O'Malley - she is trapped inside a room and ready to negotiate for her life.
blurb.B3: She needs a keycard to get out of the room and then you'll either have to talk Porter into letting her go,
blurb.B4: or make safe passage for her to take the Vents out.
blurb.B5: If you decide to help her escape she says will give your Anton's Data and the quest will update  "find an escape route".
blurb.B6: You can persuade (30) her to have her people stand down.
blurb.B7: She will then ask you to clear a path and says she will pay you once she is clear.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: You care to explain what you're doing here? Did you miss the big sign outside?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Anton sent me to help. You're in charge of security?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm no threat. Just a passing freelancer looking for work.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: That I am. Name's Porter. If Doc Crane did send you, I'd be glad for the help.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Bad news is, we haven't been able to clean these outlaws out of the lab. Good news is, they haven't been able escape, neither.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So it's a stalemate.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Could they get out through the vents?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: For now. I reckon they got no backup. On the other hand, we don't neither. And our mechanicals all went haywire for some damn reason.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Damn mechanicals have always been more trouble than they're worth.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Where can I find your office?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How are you holding the attackers down there? A place like this must have more than one exit.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What exactly do you do here?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Why you wanna know that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I need a security keycard.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I want to be sure it's secure. You said the outlaws could make a card there.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: What for?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm going down after these guys. I don't want to get trapped by a door you locked behind you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Honestly, I just want to look around this place.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Fair point. Here's a keycard to my office. Head left from here and downstairs. It's across from the cafeteria. I got a machine that makes pass cards for us.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Just don't knock over any paperwork in there. I got a system.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Enough talk. Those outlaws won't wait forever.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm gonna be honest in turn and say ''no.'' Bad enough we got outlaws trying to pick the place clean.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: One level down, across from the cafeteria. But I locked it up, and I got the only keycard. To get in, they'd have to blow it. We'd hear.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you're wrong, they'll take everything you've got stashed in there.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And you've been watching to make sure no one sneaks in the whole time since?

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: If they reach my office, we're screwed anyway.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, no. But like I said, to get it open, they'd have to bust the lock.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: The garage and the front door are it. These bastards got in through the vent system, but we locked that down.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: They're not getting back out that way without a security keycard. They'd need to take mine. Or make a new one in my office, I guess.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be back.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: Who, me? Or you mean the lab in general?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind. I'm heading downstairs.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's how they got in. We got that locked down. There's no access from their level without a security keycard.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: That also means no fresh air down there. Probably reeks of raptidon musk. Couldn't happen to a nicer bunch.

dialog.speaker: Porter (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm Porter, chief of "Site Safety Engineering." That's a fancy way of saying "guards."
